subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanji|grade=c|rs=犬10}}

# [[monkey]]

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{swp|lang=ja|サル}} {{swp|Monkey}} [[File:JapaneseMacaqueM2218.jpg|thumb|250px|{{m|ja|猿|tr=saru, mashi, mashira}}: a '''[[monkey]]''', specifically a [[Japanese macaque]].]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さる}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=さる|-}}. Appears in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'', completed some time after 759 CE. Ultimate derivation possibly borrowed from {{bor|sort=さる|ja|ain|サロ|tr=saro||monkey|pos=from {{m|ain|サㇻ|tr=sar||a tail}} + {{m|ain|オ|tr=o||to bear, to wear, to carry}}}}.{{R:ain:B}} The kanji is from {{der|ja|zh|猿||[[ape]]|sort=さる}}. Compare {{cog|ja|猪|tr=inoshishi||[[boar]]}} from {{cog|zh|猪||[[pig]]}} and {{cog|ja|豚|tr=buta||[[pig]]}} from {{cog|zh|豚||[[suckling]] [[pig]]}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|さる|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: {{U:ja:biology|サル}}

subSections.title: Descendants
subSections.text: * → Yami: {{l|tao|sazo}}

{{ja-noun|まし}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=まし|archaic|possibly|_|obsolete}} a [[monkey]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This form seems to be used less often than ''mashira'' below.

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ましら}}

Derived from earlier ''mashi'' form above.  Found in texts from the early 1900s, possibly earlier.  Appears to be ''mashi'' + the pluralizing and genericizing suffix {{m|ja|ら|tr=ra}}.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|ましら|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ましら}}
